member.name: T:SixLabors.Fonts.BigEndianBitConverter
member.summary:
Equivalent of , but with either endianness.
Adapted from Miscellaneous Utility Library This product includes software developed by Jon Skeet and Marc Gravell. Contact , or see .

member.name: M:SixLabors.Fonts.BigEndianBitConverter.DoubleToInt64Bits(System.Double)
member.summary: Converts the specified double-precision floating point number to a 64-bit signed integer. Note: the endianness of this converter does not affect the returned value.
member.returns: A 64-bit signed integer whose value is equivalent to value.

member.name: M:SixLabors.Fonts.BigEndianBitConverter.Int64BitsToDouble(System.Int64)
member.summary: Converts the specified 64-bit signed integer to a double-precision floating point number. Note: the endianness of this converter does not affect the returned value.
member.returns: A double-precision floating point number whose value is equivalent to value.

member.name: M:SixLabors.Fonts.BigEndianBitConverter.SingleToInt32Bits(System.Single)
member.summary: Converts the specified single-precision floating point number to a 32-bit signed integer. Note: the endianness of this converter does not affect the returned value.
member.returns: A 32-bit signed integer whose value is equivalent to value.

member.name: M:SixLabors.Fonts.BigEndianBitConverter.Int32BitsToSingle(System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts the specified 32-bit signed integer to a single-precision floating point number. Note: the endianness of this converter does not affect the returned value.
member.returns: A single-precision floating point number whose value is equivalent to value.

member.name: M:SixLabors.Fonts.BigEndianBitConverter.ToBoolean(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a Boolean value converted from one byte at a specified position in a byte array.
member.returns: true if the byte at startIndex in value is nonzero; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:SixLabors.Fonts.BigEndianBitConverter.ToChar(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a Unicode character converted from two bytes at a specified position in a byte array.
member.returns: A character formed by two bytes beginning at startIndex.

member.name: M:SixLabors.Fonts.BigEndianBitConverter.ToDouble(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a double-precision floating point number converted from eight bytes at a specified position in a byte array.
member.returns: A double precision floating point number formed by eight bytes beginning at startIndex.

member.name: M:SixLabors.Fonts.BigEndianBitConverter.ToSingle(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a single-precision floating point number converted from four bytes at a specified position in a byte array.
member.returns: A single precision floating point number formed by four bytes beginning at startIndex.

member.name: M:SixLabors.Fonts.BigEndianBitConverter.ToInt16(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a 16-bit signed integer converted from two bytes at a specified position in a byte array.
member.returns: A 16-bit signed integer formed by two bytes beginning at startIndex.

member.name: M:SixLabors.Fonts.BigEndianBitConverter.ToInt32(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a 32-bit signed integer converted from four bytes at a specified position in a byte array.
member.returns: A 32-bit signed integer formed by four bytes beginning at startIndex.

member.name: M:SixLabors.Fonts.BigEndianBitConverter.ToInt64(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a 64-bit signed integer converted from eight bytes at a specified position in a byte array.
member.returns: A 64-bit signed integer formed by eight bytes beginning at startIndex.

member.name: M:SixLabors.Fonts.BigEndianBitConverter.ToUInt16(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a 16-bit unsigned integer converted from two bytes at a specified position in a byte array.
member.returns: A 16-bit unsigned integer formed by two bytes beginning at startIndex.

member.name: M:SixLabors.Fonts.BigEndianBitConverter.ToUInt32(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a 32-bit unsigned integer converted from four bytes at a specified position in a byte array.
member.returns: A 32-bit unsigned integer formed by four bytes beginning at startIndex.

member.name: M:SixLabors.Fonts.BigEndianBitConverter.ToUInt64(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a 64-bit unsigned integer converted from eight bytes at a specified position in a byte array.
member.returns: A 64-bit unsigned integer formed by eight bytes beginning at startIndex.

member.name: M:SixLabors.Fonts.BigEndianBitConverter.CheckByteArgument(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks the given argument for validity.
member.exception: startIndex is less than zero or greater than the length of value minus bytesRequired.

member.name: M:SixLabors.Fonts.BigEndianBitConverter.CheckedFromBytes(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks the arguments for validity before calling FromBytes (which can therefore assume the arguments are valid).
member.param: The bytes to convert after checking
The index of the first byte to convert
The number of bytes to convert
member.returns: The

member.name: M:SixLabors.Fonts.BigEndianBitConverter.ToString(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Returns a String converted from the elements of a byte array.
member.remarks: All the elements of value are converted.
member.returns: A String of hexadecimal pairs separated by hyphens, where each pair represents the corresponding element in value; for example, "7F-2C-4A".

member.name: M:SixLabors.Fonts.BigEndianBitConverter.ToString(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a String converted from the elements of a byte array starting at a specified array position.
member.remarks: The elements from array position startIndex to the end of the array are converted.
member.returns: A String of hexadecimal pairs separated by hyphens, where each pair represents the corresponding element in value; for example, "7F-2C-4A".

member.name: M:SixLabors.Fonts.BigEndianBitConverter.ToString(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a String converted from a specified number of bytes at a specified position in a byte array.
member.param: The number of bytes to convert.
member.remarks: The length elements from array position startIndex are converted.
member.returns: A String of hexadecimal pairs separated by hyphens, where each pair represents the corresponding element in value; for example, "7F-2C-4A".

member.name: M:SixLabors.Fonts.BigEndianBitConverter.ToDecimal(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a decimal value converted from sixteen bytes at a specified position in a byte array.
member.returns: A decimal formed by sixteen bytes beginning at startIndex.

member.name: M:SixLabors.Fonts.BigEndianBitConverter.GetBytes(System.Decimal)
member.summary: Returns the specified decimal value as an array of bytes.
member.returns: An array of bytes with length 16.

member.name: M:SixLabors.Fonts.BinaryReader.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads the specified number of bytes into the given buffer, starting at the given index.
member.param: The buffer to copy data into
The first index to copy data into
The number of bytes to read
member.returns: The number of bytes actually read. This will only be less than the requested number of bytes if the end of the stream is reached.

member.name: M:SixLabors.Fonts.BinaryReader.ReadBytes(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads the specified number of bytes, returning them in a new byte array. If not enough bytes are available before the end of the stream, this method will return what is available.
member.param: The number of bytes to read
member.returns: The bytes read

member.name: M:SixLabors.Fonts.BinaryReader.ReadBytesOrThrow(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads the specified number of bytes, returning them in a new byte array. If not enough bytes are available before the end of the stream, this method will throw an IOException.
member.param: The number of bytes to read
member.returns: The bytes read

member.name: M:SixLabors.Fonts.BinaryReader.Read7BitEncodedInt
member.summary: Reads a 7-bit encoded integer from the stream. This is stored with the least significant information first, with 7 bits of information per byte of value, and the top bit as a continuation flag. This method is not affected by the endianness of the bit converter.
member.returns: The 7-bit encoded integer read from the stream.

member.name: M:SixLabors.Fonts.BinaryReader.ReadString(System.Int32,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Reads a string of a specific length, which specifies the number of bytes to read from the stream. These bytes are then converted into a string with the encoding for this reader.
member.returns: The string read from the stream.

member.name: M:SixLabors.Fonts.BinaryReader.ReadTag
member.summary: Reads the uint32 string.
member.returns: a 4 character long UTF8 encoded string

member.name: M:SixLabors.Fonts.BinaryReader.ReadInternal(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads the given number of bytes from the stream, throwing an exception if they can't all be read.

member.name: M:SixLabors.Fonts.BinaryReader.TryReadInternal(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads the given number of bytes from the stream if possible, returning the number of bytes actually read, which may be less than requested if (and only if) the end of the stream is reached.
member.returns: Number of bytes actually read

member.name: F:SixLabors.Fonts.IO.ZlibInflateStream.isDisposed
member.summary: A value indicating whether this instance of the given entity has been disposed.
member.value: if this instance has been disposed; otherwise, .
member.remarks: If the entity is disposed, it must not be disposed a second time. The isDisposed field is set the first time the entity is disposed. If the isDisposed field is true, then the Dispose() method will not dispose again. This help not to prolong the entity's life in the Garbage Collector.

member.name: F:SixLabors.Fonts.WellKnownIds.EncodingIDs.Unicode11
member.summary: Unicode 1.1 semantics

member.name: F:SixLabors.Fonts.WellKnownIds.EncodingIDs.ISO10646
member.summary: ISO/IEC 10646 semantics

member.name: F:SixLabors.Fonts.WellKnownIds.EncodingIDs.Unicode2
member.summary: Unicode 2.0 and onwards semantics, Unicode BMP only (cmap subtable formats 0, 4, 6).

member.name: F:SixLabors.Fonts.WellKnownIds.EncodingIDs.Unicode2Plus
member.summary: Unicode 2.0 and onwards semantics, Unicode full repertoire (cmap subtable formats 0, 4, 6, 10, 12).

member.name: F:SixLabors.Fonts.WellKnownIds.EncodingIDs.UnicodeVariationSequences
member.summary: Unicode Variation Sequences (cmap subtable format 14).

member.name: F:SixLabors.Fonts.WellKnownIds.EncodingIDs.UnicodeFull
member.summary: Unicode full repertoire (cmap subtable formats 0, 4, 6, 10, 12, 13)

member.name: T:SixLabors.Fonts.WellKnownIds.NameIds
member.summary: Common name ids

member.name: F:SixLabors.Fonts.WellKnownIds.NameIds.CopyrightNotice
member.summary: The copyright notice

member.name: F:SixLabors.Fonts.WellKnownIds.NameIds.FontFamilyName
member.summary: The font family name; Up to four fonts can share the Font Family name, forming a font style linking group (regular, italic, bold, bold italic as defined by OS/2.fsSelection bit settings).

member.name: F:SixLabors.Fonts.WellKnownIds.NameIds.FontSubfamilyName
member.summary: The font subfamily name; The Font Subfamily name distinguishes the font in a group with the same Font Family name (name ID 1). This is assumed to address style (italic, oblique) and weight (light, bold, black, etc.). A font with no particular differences in weight or style (e.g. medium weight, not italic and fsSelection bit 6 set) should have the string Regular stored in this position.

member.name: F:SixLabors.Fonts.WellKnownIds.NameIds.UniqueFontID
member.summary: The unique font identifier

member.name: F:SixLabors.Fonts.WellKnownIds.NameIds.FullFontName
member.summary: The full font name; a combination of strings 1 and 2, or a similar human-readable variant. If string 2 is "Regular", it is sometimes omitted from name ID 4.

member.name: F:SixLabors.Fonts.WellKnownIds.NameIds.Version
member.summary: Version string. Should begin with the syntax 'Version <number>.<number>' (upper case, lower case, or mixed, with a space between Version and the number). The string must contain a version number of the following form: one or more digits (0-9) of value less than 65,535, followed by a period, followed by one or more digits of value less than 65,535. Any character other than a digit will terminate the minor number. A character such as ; is helpful to separate different pieces of version information. The first such match in the string can be used by installation software to compare font versions. Note that some installers may require the string to start with Version , followed by a version number as above.

member.name: F:SixLabors.Fonts.WellKnownIds.NameIds.PostscriptName
member.summary: Postscript name for the font; Name ID 6 specifies a string which is used to invoke a PostScript language font that corresponds to this OpenType font. When translated to ASCII, the name string must be no longer than 63 characters and restricted to the printable ASCII subset, codes 33 to 126, except for the 10 characters '[', ']', '(', ')', '{', '}', '<', '>', '/', '%'. In a CFF OpenType font, there is no requirement that this name be the same as the font name in the CFFs Name INDEX. Thus, the same CFF may be shared among multiple font components in a Font Collection. See the 'name' table section of Recommendations for OpenType fonts "" for additional information.

member.name: F:SixLabors.Fonts.WellKnownIds.NameIds.Trademark
member.summary: Trademark; this is used to save any trademark notice/information for this font. Such information should be based on legal advice. This is distinctly separate from the copyright.

member.name: F:SixLabors.Fonts.WellKnownIds.NameIds.Manufacturer
member.summary: The manufacturer

member.name: F:SixLabors.Fonts.WellKnownIds.NameIds.Designer
member.summary: Designer; name of the designer of the typeface.

member.name: F:SixLabors.Fonts.WellKnownIds.NameIds.Description
member.summary: Description; description of the typeface. Can contain revision information, usage recommendations, history, features, etc.

member.name: F:SixLabors.Fonts.WellKnownIds.NameIds.VendorUrl
member.summary: URL Vendor; URL of font vendor (with protocol, e.g., http://, ftp://). If a unique serial number is embedded in the URL, it can be used to register the font.

member.name: F:SixLabors.Fonts.WellKnownIds.NameIds.DesignerUrl
member.summary: URL Designer; URL of typeface designer (with protocol, e.g., http://, ftp://).

member.name: F:SixLabors.Fonts.WellKnownIds.NameIds.LicenseDescription
member.summary: License Description; description of how the font may be legally used, or different example scenarios for licensed use. This field should be written in plain language, not legalese.

member.name: F:SixLabors.Fonts.WellKnownIds.NameIds.LicenseInfoUrl
member.summary: License Info URL; URL where additional licensing information can be found.

member.name: F:SixLabors.Fonts.WellKnownIds.NameIds.TypographicFamilyName
member.summary: Typographic Family name: The typographic family grouping doesn't impose any constraints on the number of faces within it, in contrast with the 4-style family grouping (ID 1), which is present both for historical reasons and to express style linking groups. If name ID 16 is absent, then name ID 1 is considered to be the typographic family name. (In earlier versions of the specification, name ID 16 was known as "Preferred Family".)

member.name: F:SixLabors.Fonts.WellKnownIds.NameIds.TypographicSubfamilyName
member.summary: Typographic Subfamily name: This allows font designers to specify a subfamily name within the typographic family grouping. This string must be unique within a particular typographic family. If it is absent, then name ID 2 is considered to be the typographic subfamily name. (In earlier versions of the specification, name ID 17 was known as "Preferred Subfamily".)

member.name: F:SixLabors.Fonts.WellKnownIds.NameIds.SampleText
member.summary: Sample text; This can be the font name, or any other text that the designer thinks is the best sample to display the font in.
